column4: When running sudo apt-get install build-essential i recieve the following errors: Err http://packages.freecontrib.org dapper Release.gpg
Could not connect to packages.freecontrib.org:80 (34.52.53.34), connection timed out
Err http://packages.freecontrib.org dapper/free Translation-en_US
Unable to connect to packages.freecontrib.org http:
Err http://packages.freecontrib.org dapper/non-free Translation-en_US
Unable to connect to packages.freecontrib.org http:
Dapper is outdated.
Run "lsb_release -a"  -- You'll see that it's outdated.  You want either Hardy or Jaunty.
sudo aptitude install -y pastebinit ; cat /etc/apt/sources.list | pastebinit -- Give me the link please.
Reading package lists... Done
Terminal --> "lsb_release -r" said what?
Err, I don't know why you have Dapper in your /etc/apt/sources.list but that's no longer supported.
I was following an outdated tutorial which called for the dapper l
Generally I don't know what's the appropriate fix for this because you claims to run Jaunty yet you managed to have old Dapper sources.list -- You "skipped" 3 good years right there.
Link plz.
http://www.askstudent.com/hacking/how-to-crack-a-wep-key-using-ubuntu/
You're probably better off undo everything you did and use LIVECD --> http://www.remote-exploit.org/backtrack.html
Also, there are a channel for it too.  #backtrack <-- I believe.

thanks, i just had problems mounting bt4 and wanted to try a way through ubuntu but I will try again. thanks!
